Journal Story: Woke up early to get a jump on the day. early means 5:30, when people start wrestling around getting their stuff together have their coffee and on the road by 7 o'clock. The goal was Unico Gap just under 10 miles away with several tough up hills in one big downhill at the end. The end of the hike was where Highway cross the trail and a parking lot was located for day hikers. We found Trail magic a local Baptist Church set up grills and provided burgers and chips and drinks for free sent you a picture of that already. Got a shuttle into town and decided like many others to have a 0 Day on Sunday. Good day to choose because it seem to rain a lot on and off all day and I was able to catch up on a lot of sleep. The plan for tomorrow is to get an early start on the day take the shuttle up to where we left off and start the long uphill ending about 13 miles down the trail. This will be my single longest hike to date. I was able to dictate this because I'm still under the hotel Wi-Fi so excuse the typos.
been actively gathering equipment and ideas on how to proceed. The biggest issue seems to be food and restocking is as you go along.

I have fit just about everything I can in my backpack and am nervously waiting for Monday, the day I start my walk in the woods. My pack weighs 26.5 pounds without water, which can add another 13 to 14 pounds easily. I hope I can keep to Plan A a.k.a. itinerary aka Plan A which takes me over 300 miles to Bald Mountain.
Mt Sassafras was a bit of a challenge. Took away my legs. Got to the shelter around3:30. Later down on the wood floor and napped for a bit. Went to bed at 8pm aka Hiker's midnight.

Slept in hammock was a bit cold. Woke up quite refreshed. Said something I don't say often, what a pretty sunrise. Tough hike up Sassafras Mt. Exhausted when I got to Gouches. Slept in a shelter that holds up to 14 with 3 other people; Turtle snored. Trail names are what you go by. Bear Claw and B Hiker ,Lady Bird. Dimples is from Wisconsin. She went to UW grad school.

Best day hiking. With over half way
there was a spot we crossed the highway. A van offered free shuttle to Suches and back. Had the best hot dogs! Almost midnight. It get chilly soon after sunset. Quite a steady wind. May drizzle latter. Running out of battery.

Made it to. Neel gap hostel. Showered, doing laundry and had awesome frozen pizza.   Here for the night. Having phone charger issues so will not use phone on trail much. Lousy night sleep in a bunk bead with rubber coated mattress. This is the only place the trail goes through a building. Historic landmark stone building. Great views.
My first double digit 11.5 miles day and it was an amazing hike with many challenges. Lots of up and down over 3,000 foot-plus Peaks beautiful day exhausted when done.
